text: ما اغنى عنهم ما كانوا۟ يمتعون

translations.translation: that what they enjoyed will be of any use to them?
Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?
of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?
none of their luxuries will be able to save them from the torment?
So of what benefit will be the comforts that they were using?
All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.
That which they were made to enjoy shall not avail them?
what will it then avail them, the enjoyment of days they were given?
(How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?
of what avail would their past enjoyment be to them?
What shall that which they enjoyed avail them?
of what avail to them will be that which they were given to enjoy?
It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.
what avail will their past enjoyments be to them?
Of what avail to them will be their past enjoyments?
They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
[26:207] in what way (mā here is interrogative) would that enjoyment which they were given avail them?, in averting the chastisement or mitigating it? It would be of no avail!
((How) that wherewith) Allah's punishment (they were contented) because of the reprieve (naught availeth them) from Allah's punishment? 423

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُمْ } أي: لم يدفع طول مكثهم فيها شيئاً من العذاب، ولم تخفف عذابهم { مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ } [الشعراء: 207] أي: تمتيعهم زماناً طويلاً، فإذن لا فرق بين إمهالهم وبين تعجيل العذاب عليهم
